about.about: A CLI toolkit for scaffolding, building, packaging, and distributing Android modules and templates (ksu/APU/Magisk/AnyTemplate). It supports module initialization, packaging, template management, and repository metadata exports. Use `kam help <COMMAND>` for more details about a specific command.
about.long_about: A CLI toolkit for scaffolding, building, packaging, and distributing Android modules and templates (ksu/APU/Magisk/AnyTemplate). It supports module initialization, packaging, template management, and repository metadata exports. Use `kam help <COMMAND>` for more details about a specific command.

about.summary: Display about information for Kam and credits

build.description: Builds a module or workspace member and creates artifacts in the output directory.

flags.interactive: Run build interactively; confirm potentially destructive actions
flags.jobs: Number of parallel jobs (default: number of CPU cores)
flags.path: Path to the project (default: current directory)
flags.quiet: Suppress non-essential output; show warnings and errors only

build.summary: Build and package a module into a deployable ZIP artifact

cache.description: List, add, remove, or clean cached templates and show cache directory.

flags.name: Name of the template to register
flags.path: Path to the template source (directory or archive)

add.summary: Add a template to cache from a local directory or archive

flags.name: Name of the template to remove

cache.summary: Manage local template and artifact cache

check.description: Static checking utilities for files in the project, useful for CI and local development.

flags.fix: Try to automatically fix/format files when possible
flags.path: Path to the project directory (default: current directory)

completions.description: Generate completion scripts for supported shells (bash, zsh, fish, powershell, elvish).

flags.install: Install completion script into system/user completion directories (may require root).
flags.out: Output file. If omitted, prints to STDOUT.

completions.summary: Generate shell completion scripts for common shells

config.summary: Manage per-project or global kam configuration (similar to git config)

flags.format: Export format: prop, json, update, repo, track, config
flags.output: Output file path (default: a format-specific filename in the current directory)

export.summary: Export `kam.toml` to common formats (module.prop, module.json, repo.json, track.json, config.json, update.json)

help.summary: Print this message or the help of the given subcommand(s)

init.description: Interactive and non-interactive initialization from templates; supports local archives or built-in templates, with options to prefill common metadata.

flags.author: Author name
flags.interactive: Run in interactive mode and prompt for required values
flags.name: Project path (optional in interactive mode)
flags.template: Template to use (builtin ID or local path)
flags.update_json: Update JSON URL (default: generated from git)
flags.var: Template variable in key=value format (can be repeated)

init.summary: Initialize a new Kam project from templates (supports meta and kernel templates)

install.description: Act as a compatibility layer that delegates module installation to the configured root manager (Magisk/KernelSU/APatchSU). Configure the preferred manager with `kam config set root.manager <Manager>`

flags.dry_run: Print the derived install command instead of executing it
flags.path: Path to module package (.zip). If omitted, Kam will try to find an artifact in the project's dist/ output dir

install.summary: Act as a compatibility layer for Magisk, KernelSU, and APatchSU to install modules

secret.description: Manage stored secrets: add, get, list, remove, export, import and trust CA management.

flags.file: Path to file to read the secret from
flags.file_path: Positional path to read secret from (alternative to --file)
flags.force_file: Store as a local file instead of using the system keyring
flags.name: Name for the secret
flags.password: Pass the password on the CLI (not recommended)
flags.with_backup: Also create a local fallback file under ~/.kam/secrets

add.summary: Add a secret from a value or file

export.summary: Export secret to a file (default: decrypted; use --encrypted to export encrypted blob)

flags.name: Name of the secret (default: main)
flags.out: Output file path (if omitted, prints to stdout)

exportpub.summary: Export public key from a stored private key secret

flags.out: Write to file instead of stdout
flags.password: Pass password on the CLI (not recommended)

get.summary: Get a secret and print it to stdout (or write to file)

flags.cert_chain: Path to certificate chain PEM file
flags.issue: GitHub issue number containing the certificate (optional)
flags.name: Name to store certificate under

importcert.summary: Import developer certificate chain from GitHub issue or file

flags.add_root: Add a Root CA from file or URL

secret.summary: Secret keyring management (used by sign/verify tasks)

flags.all: Sign all artifacts inside dist (alias of --dist with default dist)
flags.cert: Certificate PEM chain path to include in signature metadata
flags.dist: Sign all artifacts in given directory (alternative to src)
flags.key_path: Optional path to private key PEM file to use instead of keyring secret
flags.secret: Name of the keyring secret holding the private key (default: main)
flags.src: Artifact to sign (zip). If omitted, use --dist or --all to sign multiple files

sign.summary: Sign an artifact using a key from the keyring or a PEM file

tmpl.description: Manage templates including import/export, listing and path queries.

flags.output: Output file path (.tar.gz for single, .zip for multiple)
flags.templates: Template name(s) to export (can specify multiple)

flags.force: Force overwrite if template already exists
flags.name: Template name (optional; defaults to filename)
flags.path: Path to template archive (.tar.gz for single, .zip for multiple)

flags.global: Flag accepted for consistency but has no effect (uses config)
flags.url: Download URL (defaults to GitHub latest release templates ZIP)

pull.summary: Download templates from a URL and import them

flags.global: Flag accepted for consistency but has no effect (uses config)

update.summary: Re-download based on recorded URL in config and import

tmpl.summary: Manage templates: import, export, package, and list

flags.file: Operate on this file instead of project's kam.toml

toml.summary: Inspect and edit `kam.toml` using dot-path keys (get/set/unset/list)

validate.description: Validate kam.toml, templates, and project structure for errors and warnings.

flags.path: Path to the project directory (default: current directory)

verify.description: Verify digital signatures or sigstore bundles; supports a variety of verification options.
verify.summary: Verify an artifact signature (.sig) or a sigstore bundle (DSSE)

version.description: Manage and query module versions, bump policies, and automated versioning helpers.
version.summary: Manage module versions and bump policies
